Container.Name: SzurubooruCompanion
Container.Overview:
Szurubooru Companion (CCC) - Upload and auto-tag media to Szurubooru with AI tagging (WD14), gallery-dl, and yt-dlp. Includes FastAPI backend, React dashboard, PostgreSQL, and Redis in a single container via s6-overlay.
NEW: Database-backed multi-user system. All configuration done via dashboard UI at http://[IP]:21425/settings. Only ADMIN_USER, ADMIN_PASSWORD, and ENCRYPTION_KEY are needed - everything else configured after login!
Container.Description:
Szurubooru Companion (CCC) - A multi-component workflow for uploading media to Szurubooru with AI tagging. Includes: FastAPI backend, React dashboard, PostgreSQL, Redis (all in one container via s6-overlay).
After first startup, login at /login with ADMIN_USER/ADMIN_PASSWORD, then configure your Szurubooru + site credentials in Settings.

Config.Name: App Data
Config.Description: Application data (database, jobs, WD14 model cache)

Config.Name: Config
Config.Description: Configuration files (place config.json here for gallery-dl)

Config.Name: Admin Username
Config.Description: Admin username (created on first startup, then stored in database)

Config.Name: Admin Password
Config.Description: Admin password (REQUIRED - set a strong password)

Config.Name: Encryption Key
Config.Description: Fernet encryption key for credentials. Generate with: python -c 'from cryptography.fernet import Fernet; print(Fernet.generate_key().decode())'

Config.Name: API Key
Config.Description: API key for mobile app and external access (leave empty to disable)

Config.Name: WD14 Enabled
Config.Description: Enable AI tagging via WD14 (downloads ~2GB model on first run)

Config.Name: WD14 Model
Config.Description: HuggingFace model name for WD14 tagger

Config.Name: WD14 Confidence Threshold
Config.Description: Minimum confidence to include a tag (0.0-1.0)

Config.Name: WD14 Max Tags
Config.Description: Maximum number of AI tags per image

Config.Name: Debug Mode
Config.Description: Enable debug mode (not recommended for production)

Config.Name: CORS Origins
Config.Description: Allowed CORS origins (comma-separated, or * for all). Set to your domain if behind a reverse proxy.
